Posts.Title: Do you recommend one of these famous cancer centers for general consultation?

Posts.Content: An informed decision alone gives some peace of mind. Yet, the cancer journey often has no easy choices, and making one choice will often eliminate the others. You are doing the right thing by having more pairs of eyes on your case.

Posts.Title: 28 Year old and have most symptoms of PC

Posts.Content: This is merely anecdotal, but I was prescribed Trazodone for insomnia. It is primarily an anti-depressant and anti-anxiety drug, but also has the effect of producing sleep. However, I found also that it produces the same desired effect as Flomax, apparently causing some muscle relaxation. My hematologist described it as a "clean drug" - one with few disadvantages in that it may be stopped and started without tapers, and that seems to be easy for the body to metabolize and eliminate. Dosage makes quite a difference in my case, so one may have to experiment a bit to find the ideal balance of effects. Compared to many others it is also quite affordable, being a long established drug.

Posts.Title: insomnia with flowmax, alternative?

Posts.Content: Aaron, the very first word in your thread title tells volumes. You are suffering from fear, anxiety - whatever you choose to call it. First, consult with a (different) doctor regarding the pain, then be absolutely certain to tell doctor of the fear and anxiety that is dominating your thoughts. No one has told you that you have anything wrong, let alone cancer. Do both of these things are you will once again have some peace of mind.

Posts.Title: Terrified That I Have Prostate Cancer

Posts.Content: Lupron and Bicalutamide are not chemotherapy drugs. If I understand correctly (I'm a lymphoma guy), they are hormone antagonists, which have the ultimate effect of reducing the production of hormones which facilitate prostate cancer growth. They have side effects (as does aspirin), but I see no evidence that they interfere with the immune system, or directly attack human tissues, as most chemotherapy drugs do. Remember also that the doctors are not out to kill your father, but to save him by killing the cancer. They well know the dosages which are safe and appropriate, given your dad's overall health. Any adverse reaction he has can be controlled, or the drug reduced or eliminated, depending on how his treatment proceeds. As to chemotherapy worries, I was 10 years younger than your dad, but I received maximum doses of eight chemotherapy drugs in four months. I went on to receive 17 chemotherapy drugs total, and I am still alive, and happy to be so. The immediate concern with your dad is to kill or greatly slow down the cancer. And, if doctor is concerned, taking the treatment up a notch seems to be appropriate. Will it be easy? No, but cancer is harder.
Posts.Signature: 05/08-07/08 Tumor appears behind left ear. Followed by serial medical incompetence on the parts of PCP, veteran oncologist and pathologist (misdiagnosis via non-diagnosis). Providential guidance to proper care at an NCI designated comprehensive cancer center. 07/08 Age 56 DX 1) Peripheral T-Cell Lymphoma-Not Otherwise Specified. Stage IV-B, >50 ("innumerable") tumors, bone marrow involvement. 08/08-12/08 Four cycles CHOEP14 + four cycles GND (Cyclofosfamide, Doxorubicin, Vincristine, Etoposide, Prednisone & Gemcitabine, Navelbine, Doxil) 02/09 2) Relapse. 03/09-06/13 Clinical trial of Romidepsin > long-term study. NED for 64 twenty-eight day cycles, dose tapered. 07/13 3) Relapse, 4) Suspected Mutation. 08/13-02/14 Romidepsin increased, stopped for lack of response. Watch & Wait. 09/14 Relapse/Progression. Visible cervical nodes appear within 4 days of being checked clear. 10/06/14 One cycle Belinostat. Discontinued to enter second clinical trial. 10/25/14 Clinical trial of Alisertib/Failed - Progression. 01/12/15 Belinostat resumed/Failed - Progression. 02/23/15 02/24/15 Pralatrexate/Failed - Progression. 04/17/15 04/15 Genomic profiling reveals mutation into PTCL-NOS + AngioImmunoblastic T-Cell Lymphoma. Stage IV-B a second time. Two dozen tumors + small intestine (Ileum) involvement. 04/22/15 TEC (Bendamustine, Etoposide, Carboplatin). Full response in two cycles. PET/CT both clear. Third cycle followed. 06/15-07/15 Transplant preparation (X-rays, spinal taps, BMB, blood test, MUGA scan, lung function, CMV screening, C-Diff testing etc. etc. etc.) Intrathecal Methotrexate during spinal tap. BMB reveals 5) 26% blast cells of 20q Deletion Myelodysplastic Syndrome MDS), a bone marrow cancer and precursor to Acute Myeloid Leukemia. 07/11-12/15 Cyclofosfamide + Fludarabine conditioning regimen. 07/16/15 Total Body Irradiation. 07/17/15 Moderate intensity Haploidentical Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplant receiving my son's peripheral blood stem cells. 07/21-22/15 Triple dose Cyclofosfamide + Mesna, followed by immunosuppressants Tacrolimus and Mycophenolate Mofetil. 07/23-08/03/15 Marrow producing zero blood cells. Fever. Hospitalized two weeks. 08/04/15 Engraftment occurs, and blood cells are measurable - released from hospital. 08/13/15 Day 26 - Marrow is 100% donor cells. Platelets climbing steadily, red cells follow. 09/21/15 Acute skin Graft versus Host Disease arrives. DEXA scan reveals Osteoporosis. 09/26/-11/03/15 Prednisone to control skin GvHD. 11/2015 Acute GvHD re-classified to Chronic Graft versus Host Disease. 05/2016 Tacrolimus stopped. Prednisone from 30-90mg daily tried. Sirolimus begun. Narrow-band UV-B therapy started, but discontinued for lack of response. One treatment of P-UVAreceived, but halted due to medication reaction. 09/16/16 Three skin punch biopsies. 11/04/16 GvHD clinical trial of Ofatumumab (Arzerra) + Prednisone + Methylprednisolone begun. 12/16 Type II Diabetes, Hypertension - both treatment-related. 05/17 Extracorporeal Photopheresis (ECP) begun in attempt to control chronic Graft-versus-Host-Disease (cGvHD. 8 year old Power Port removed and replaced with Vortex (Smart) Port for ECP. 05/2017 Chronic anemia (low hematocrit). Chronic kidney disease. Cataracts from radiation and steroids. 06/17 Trying various antibiotics in a search for tolerable prophylaxis. 08/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals the presence of 2% cells with 20q Deletion Myelodysplastic Syndrome, considered to be Minimum Residual Disease. 12/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals no abnormalities in the marrow - MDS eradicated. The steroid taper continues. 01/18 Consented for Kadmon clinical trial. 03/18 Began 400mg daily of KD025, a rho-Associated Coiled-coil Kinase 2 Inhibitor (ROCK2). 09/18 Due to refractory GvHD, Extracorporeal Photopheresis halted after 15 months ue to lack of additional benefit. 10/18 I was withdrawn from the Kadmon KD025 clinical trial due to increasing fatigue/lack of benefit. 11/18 Began therapy with Ruxolitinib (Jakafi), a JAK 1&2 inhibitor class drug. Started at half-dose due to concerns with drug interactions. To date: 1 cancer, relapse, second relapse/mutation into 2 cancers, then 3 cancers simultaneously, 20 chemotherapy/GVHD drugs in 11 regimens (4 of them at least twice), 5 salvage regimens, 4 clinical trials, 5 post-transplant immuno-suppressant/modulatory drugs, the equivalent of 1,000 years of background radiation from 40+ CT series scans and about 24 PET scans. Both lymphoid and myeloid malignancies lend a certain symmetry to the hematological journey. Believing in the redemptive value of suffering makes all the difference.
Posts.Title: Chemohormonal Therapy in Metastatic Prostate Cancer

Posts.Content: Lupron and Bicalutamide are not chemotherapy drugs. If I understand correctly (I'm a lymphoma guy), they are hormone antagonists, which have the ultimate effect of reducing the production of hormones which facilitate prostate cancer growth. They have side effects (as does aspirin), but I see no evidence that they interfere with the immune system, or directly attack human tissues, as most chemotherapy drugs do. Remember also that the doctors are not out to kill your father, but to save him by killing the cancer. They well know the dosages which are safe and appropriate, given your dad's overall health. Any adverse reaction he has can be controlled, or the drug reduced or eliminated, depending on how his treatment proceeds. As to chemotherapy worries, I was 10 years younger than your dad, but I received maximum doses of eight chemotherapy drugs in four months. I went on to receive 17 chemotherapy drugs total, and I am still alive, and happy to be so. The immediate concern with your dad is to kill or greatly slow down the cancer. And, if doctor is concerned, taking the treatment up a notch seems to be appropriate. Will it be easy? No, but cancer is harder.

Posts.Title: Looks like old guys over 70 do not have to worry about death from PC

Posts.Content: 1. "Prognosis" is a statistical construct and applies only to patient populations. 2. It does not apply to any individual. 3. Someone not only survives each and every cancer, but thrives. 4. Aim to be that someone. Vastly different cancer(s), but in 2017 I was given a 99.5% chance of not surviving my various diagnoses. I chose not to listen.

Posts.Title: Prognosis, do you believe your doctor?

Posts.Content: I still have my prostate, although I wish I had only about half of it. What I was thinking is that some localized inflammation may have occurred, causing the difficulty. Or surgery-related nerve impingement that might take some time to resolve?

One treatment of P-UVAreceived, but halted due to medication reaction. 09/16/16 Three skin punch biopsies. 11/04/16 GvHD clinical trial of Ofatumumab (Arzerra) + Prednisone + Methylprednisolone begun. 12/16 Type II Diabetes, Hypertension - both treatment-related. 05/17 Extracorporeal Photopheresis (ECP) begun in attempt to control chronic Graft-versus-Host-Disease (cGvHD. 8 year old Power Port removed and replaced with Vortex (Smart) Port for ECP. 05/2017 Chronic anemia (low hematocrit). Chronic kidney disease. Cataracts from radiation and steroids. 06/17 Trying various antibiotics in a search for tolerable prophylaxis. 08/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals the presence of 2% cells with 20q Deletion Myelodysplastic Syndrome, considered to be Minimum Residual Disease. 12/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals no abnormalities in the marrow - MDS eradicated. The steroid taper continues. 01/18 Consented for Kadmon clinical trial. 03/18 Began 400mg daily of KD025, a rho-Associated Coiled-coil Kinase 2 Inhibitor (ROCK2). 09/18 Due to refractory GvHD, Extracorporeal Photopheresis halted after 15 months ue to lack of additional benefit. 10/18 I was withdrawn from the Kadmon KD025 clinical trial due to increasing fatigue/lack of benefit. 11/18 Began therapy with Ruxolitinib (Jakafi), a JAK 1&2 inhibitor class drug. Started at half-dose due to concerns with drug interactions. Posts.Content: Doctor will advise you of the risks associated with the biopsy before any such procedure is attempted. The default position is that the biopsy is safer than having undetected PC, right? Have you been diagnosed before with PC?

Posts.Title: Prostate Biospys safe?

Posts.Content: I am assuming the the prostatectomy was because of prostate cancer. For that reason I have moved your post to the prostate cancer forum, where you will receive many more replies. So soon after the operation, and considering all that was done, I don't think that such a difficulty would be any cause for concern. Be sure to mention it to doctor at your follow up appointment.

Platelets climbing steadily, red cells follow. 09/21/15 Acute skin Graft versus Host Disease arrives. DEXA scan reveals Osteoporosis. 09/26/-11/03/15 Prednisone to control skin GvHD. 11/2015 Acute GvHD re-classified to Chronic Graft versus Host Disease. 05/2016 Tacrolimus stopped. Prednisone from 30-90mg daily tried. Sirolimus begun. Narrow-band UV-B therapy started, but discontinued for lack of response. One treatment of P-UVAreceived, but halted due to medication reaction. 09/16/16 Three skin punch biopsies. 11/04/16 GvHD clinical trial of Ofatumumab (Arzerra) + Prednisone + Methylprednisolone begun. 12/16 Type II Diabetes, Hypertension - both treatment-related. 05/17 Extracorporeal Photopheresis (ECP) begun in attempt to control chronic Graft-versus-Host-Disease (cGvHD. 8 year old Power Port removed and replaced with Vortex (Smart) Port for ECP. 05/2017 Chronic anemia (low hematocrit). Chronic kidney disease. Cataracts from radiation and steroids. 06/17 Trying various antibiotics in a search for tolerable prophylaxis. 08/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals the presence of 2% cells with 20q Deletion Myelodysplastic Syndrome, considered to be Minimum Residual Disease. 12/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals no abnormalities in the marrow - MDS eradicated. The steroid taper continues. 01/18 Consented for Kadmon clinical trial. 03/18 Began 400mg daily of KD025, a rho-Associated Coiled-coil Kinase 2 Inhibitor (ROCK2). 09/18 Due to refractory GvHD, Extracorporeal Photopheresis halted after 15 months ue to lack of additional benefit. 10/18 I was withdrawn from the Kadmon KD025 clinical trial due to increasing fatigue/lack of benefit. 11/18 Began therapy with Ruxolitinib (Jakafi), a JAK 1&2 inhibitor class drug. Started at half-dose due to concerns with drug interactions. To date: 1 cancer, relapse, second relapse/mutation into 2 cancers, then 3 cancers simultaneously, 20 chemotherapy/GVHD drugs in 11 regimens (4 of them at least twice), 5 salvage regimens, 4 clinical trials, 5 post-transplant immuno-suppressant/modulatory drugs, the equivalent of 1,000 years of background radiation from 40+ CT series scans and about 24 PET scans. Both lymphoid and myeloid malignancies lend a certain symmetry to the hematological journey. Believing in the redemptive value of suffering makes all the difference.
Posts.Title: small slow stream

Posts.Content: Brian, I moved this to the prostate forum, since you are a patient with a former diagnosis. First, there is a threshold beneath which certain things simply cannot be detected. 0.02% is extremely low for your age (those with a prostate). If it was 0.0199%, would that be any more or less comfort? Probably a call to the lab would clear this up, but since the prior level was "less than or equal to", it could have been 0.02% before, with the current test being absolutely identical. The range of the first reading means that you have no real standard with which to compare this new reading, as it could indeed have been 0.0199% before - a basically immeasurable difference. I think you are just experiencing some 'noise' in all of this. I am not a prostate patient, so I will let those with more expertise contribute.

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by lancepeace These are some treatments in trials for prostate cancer: MLN8237 oral med for neuroendocrine or mcrpc prostate cancer Phase II began Feb. 2013 I spoke with an infusion nurse at SCCA (Fred Hutchinson) today and she told me that Alisertib (MLN8237) has shown some very good responses in ovarian cancer and other solid tumor cancers. It is known to be effective in many cases against non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma. I just entered the phase III trial of Alisertib for what appears to be an unknown sub-type of of AngioImmunoblastic T-Cell Lymphoma and after a single cycle, doctor can detect only one of perhaps 8-10 tumors that were palpable. So, yes, there is much hope.

Posts.Title: thanks for new treatments

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by FriscoTx I have completed my radiation treatment for prostate cancer and have received PSA results of 1.6 & 1.8 for last two tests after treatment. My radiologist said that Medicare will cover PSA tests every 6 months for 5 years after having had prostate cancer treatment. Is this true? Welcome! You might call the doctor's business office, as they have probably billed Medicare before and would know. Or, have a look at this page: http://www.medicareinteractive.org/g...cer-screenings

Posts.Title: PSA test frequency covered under Medicare

Posts.Content: You've tried Tamsulosin (Flowmax)? I used it for a time, but discontinued it after I experienced some incontinence. That, however, may have been caused by a thickening of my bladder walls (probably due to chronic steroid use). In a similar vein, so to speak, my hematologist prescribed Trazodone for problems with insomnia. I found that it definitely helps with sleep. A welcome side effect in my case was improved flow and voiding. I was initially concerned, as it is primarily used as an anti-anxiety and anti-depression medication, but has those two beneficial side effects in my case. It is a relatively affordable "clean drug" and one may start and stop it at will. Just a thought, in case you want to discuss either drug with your doctor.

To date: 1 cancer, relapse, second relapse/mutation into 2 cancers, then 3 cancers simultaneously, 20 chemotherapy/GVHD drugs in 11 regimens (4 of them at least twice), 5 salvage regimens, 4 clinical trials, 5 post-transplant immuno-suppressant/modulatory drugs, the equivalent of 1,000 years of background radiation from 40+ CT series scans and about 24 PET scans. Both lymphoid and myeloid malignancies lend a certain symmetry to the hematological journey. Believing in the redemptive value of suffering makes all the difference.
Posts.Title: Urolift

Posts.Content: Welcome, and great news on the inflammation biopsy results. i moved your thread into the "worried" forum, as you do not have a diagnosis, and hopefully never will. I notified the prostate forum moderator, so he may reply to you. At your, I mean "our" age, a rise in PSA is not at all unusual - in fact expected. According to the chart on this page: http://www.medicinenet.com/prostate_...igen/page3.htm you are still within the normal range for your age. So, yearly monitoring may be appropriate. You might arrange for a second opinion, as medical opinions do vary somewhat.
Posts.Signature: 05/08-07/08 Tumor appears behind left ear. Followed by serial medical incompetence on the parts of PCP, veteran oncologist and pathologist (misdiagnosis via non-diagnosis). Providential guidance to proper care at an NCI designated comprehensive cancer center. 07/08 Age 56 DX 1) Peripheral T-Cell Lymphoma-Not Otherwise Specified. Stage IV-B, >50 ("innumerable") tumors, bone marrow involvement. 08/08-12/08 Four cycles CHOEP14 + four cycles GND (Cyclofosfamide, Doxorubicin, Vincristine, Etoposide, Prednisone & Gemcitabine, Navelbine, Doxil) 02/09 2) Relapse. 03/09-06/13 Clinical trial of Romidepsin > long-term study. NED for 64 twenty-eight day cycles, dose tapered. 07/13 3) Relapse, 4) Suspected Mutation. 08/13-02/14 Romidepsin increased, stopped for lack of response. Watch & Wait. 09/14 Relapse/Progression. Visible cervical nodes appear within 4 days of being checked clear. 10/06/14 One cycle Belinostat. Discontinued to enter second clinical trial. 10/25/14 Clinical trial of Alisertib/Failed - Progression. 01/12/15 Belinostat resumed/Failed - Progression. 02/23/15 02/24/15 Pralatrexate/Failed - Progression. 04/17/15 04/15 Genomic profiling reveals mutation into PTCL-NOS + AngioImmunoblastic T-Cell Lymphoma. Stage IV-B a second time. Two dozen tumors + small intestine (Ileum) involvement. 04/22/15 TEC (Bendamustine, Etoposide, Carboplatin). Full response in two cycles. PET/CT both clear. Third cycle followed. 06/15-07/15 Transplant preparation (X-rays, spinal taps, BMB, blood test, MUGA scan, lung function, CMV screening, C-Diff testing etc. etc. etc.) Intrathecal Methotrexate during spinal tap. BMB reveals 5) 26% blast cells of 20q Deletion Myelodysplastic Syndrome MDS), a bone marrow cancer and precursor to Acute Myeloid Leukemia. 07/11-12/15 Cyclofosfamide + Fludarabine conditioning regimen. 07/16/15 Total Body Irradiation. 07/17/15 Moderate intensity Haploidentical Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplant receiving my son's peripheral blood stem cells. 07/21-22/15 Triple dose Cyclofosfamide + Mesna, followed by immunosuppressants Tacrolimus and Mycophenolate Mofetil. 07/23-08/03/15 Marrow producing zero blood cells. Fever. Hospitalized two weeks. 08/04/15 Engraftment occurs, and blood cells are measurable - released from hospital. 08/13/15 Day 26 - Marrow is 100% donor cells. Platelets climbing steadily, red cells follow. 09/21/15 Acute skin Graft versus Host Disease arrives. DEXA scan reveals Osteoporosis. 09/26/-11/03/15 Prednisone to control skin GvHD. 11/2015 Acute GvHD re-classified to Chronic Graft versus Host Disease. 05/2016 Tacrolimus stopped. Prednisone from 30-90mg daily tried. Sirolimus begun. Narrow-band UV-B therapy started, but discontinued for lack of response. One treatment of P-UVAreceived, but halted due to medication reaction. 09/16/16 Three skin punch biopsies. 11/04/16 GvHD clinical trial of Ofatumumab (Arzerra) + Prednisone + Methylprednisolone begun. 12/16 Type II Diabetes, Hypertension - both treatment-related. 05/17 Extracorporeal Photopheresis (ECP) begun in attempt to control chronic Graft-versus-Host-Disease (cGvHD. 8 year old Power Port removed and replaced with Vortex (Smart) Port for ECP. 05/2017 Chronic anemia (low hematocrit). Chronic kidney disease. Cataracts from radiation and steroids. 06/17 Trying various antibiotics in a search for tolerable prophylaxis. 08/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals the presence of 2% cells with 20q Deletion Myelodysplastic Syndrome, considered to be Minimum Residual Disease. 12/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals no abnormalities in the marrow - MDS eradicated. The steroid taper continues. 01/18 Consented for Kadmon clinical trial. 03/18 Began 400mg daily of KD025, a rho-Associated Coiled-coil Kinase 2 Inhibitor (ROCK2). 09/18 Due to refractory GvHD, Extracorporeal Photopheresis halted after 15 months ue to lack of additional benefit. 10/18 I was withdrawn from the Kadmon KD025 clinical trial due to increasing fatigue/lack of benefit. 11/18 Began therapy with Ruxolitinib (Jakafi), a JAK 1&2 inhibitor class drug. Posts.Title: Monitoring Changes after negative Biopsy.

Posts.Content: Prednisone is an extremely effective anti-inflammatory. With all that has gone on in his pelvic region, there is certainly cause for some inflammation in the general area. However, until and unless that node (if it is a node) comes out and is subjected to pathology, there is only worry, and not reason to believe that it is something ominous.

Posts.Title: Lump in upper thigh reacting to early chemo. Is it metastasis?

Posts.Content: The three axioms of cancer decision making: 1. There are no easy decisions related to cancer treatment. 2. Making one choice automatically eliminates the other choice(s). 3. There is no way of knowing at the time if your choice is correct. I would think that it is time to have a serious discussion about this with your oncologist, as anecdotal stories from the web will be conflicting and may serve only to further complicate the issue. I would consult with experts in both disciplines and make specific inquiries regarding the risks and benefits.

BMB reveals 5) 26% blast cells of 20q Deletion Myelodysplastic Syndrome MDS), a bone marrow cancer and precursor to Acute Myeloid Leukemia. 07/11-12/15 Cyclofosfamide + Fludarabine conditioning regimen. 07/16/15 Total Body Irradiation. 07/17/15 Moderate intensity Haploidentical Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplant receiving my son's peripheral blood stem cells. 07/21-22/15 Triple dose Cyclofosfamide + Mesna, followed by immunosuppressants Tacrolimus and Mycophenolate Mofetil. 07/23-08/03/15 Marrow producing zero blood cells. Fever. Hospitalized two weeks. 08/04/15 Engraftment occurs, and blood cells are measurable - released from hospital. 08/13/15 Day 26 - Marrow is 100% donor cells. Platelets climbing steadily, red cells follow. 09/21/15 Acute skin Graft versus Host Disease arrives. DEXA scan reveals Osteoporosis. 09/26/-11/03/15 Prednisone to control skin GvHD. 11/2015 Acute GvHD re-classified to Chronic Graft versus Host Disease. 05/2016 Tacrolimus stopped. Prednisone from 30-90mg daily tried. Sirolimus begun. Narrow-band UV-B therapy started, but discontinued for lack of response. One treatment of P-UVAreceived, but halted due to medication reaction. 09/16/16 Three skin punch biopsies. 11/04/16 GvHD clinical trial of Ofatumumab (Arzerra) + Prednisone + Methylprednisolone begun. 12/16 Type II Diabetes, Hypertension - both treatment-related. 05/17 Extracorporeal Photopheresis (ECP) begun in attempt to control chronic Graft-versus-Host-Disease (cGvHD. 8 year old Power Port removed and replaced with Vortex (Smart) Port for ECP. 05/2017 Chronic anemia (low hematocrit). Chronic kidney disease. Cataracts from radiation and steroids. 06/17 Trying various antibiotics in a search for tolerable prophylaxis. 08/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals the presence of 2% cells with 20q Deletion Myelodysplastic Syndrome, considered to be Minimum Residual Disease. 12/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals no abnormalities in the marrow - MDS eradicated. The steroid taper continues. 01/18 Consented for Kadmon clinical trial. 03/18 Began 400mg daily of KD025, a rho-Associated Coiled-coil Kinase 2 Inhibitor (ROCK2). 09/18 Due to refractory GvHD, Extracorporeal Photopheresis halted after 15 months ue to lack of additional benefit. 10/18 I was withdrawn from the Kadmon KD025 clinical trial due to increasing fatigue/lack of benefit. 11/18 Began therapy with Ruxolitinib (Jakafi), a JAK 1&2 inhibitor class drug. Posts.Title: I'm getting worked up, first biopsy next week.

Posts.Content: The three axioms of cancer decision making: 1. There are no easy decisions related to cancer treatment. 2. Making one choice automatically eliminates the other choice(s). 3. There is no way of knowing at the time if your choice is correct. I would think that it is time to have a serious discussion about this with your oncologist, as anecdotal stories from the web will be conflicting and may serve only to further complicate the issue. I would consult with experts in both disciplines and make specific inquiries regarding the risks and benefits.

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by DjinTonic When I went to start a thread, I realized that the hyperlink button had disappeared from the editing toolbar, although hyperlinks were still showing correctly in posts. Today, that too has changed, and I'm seeing the unrendered [URL] tags along with the url's themselves. Has Forum policy changes about linking to other pages (e.g. journal abstracts and papers)? If not, it would be great if the glitch is corrected. Seeing the url's themselves makes for a very messy appearance, as well as the need for users to copy and paste them instead of simply clicking. Djin I reported that same problem to the admin. The techs have done some work regarding spam and links. Musta' boogered something up.
Posts.Signature: 05/08-07/08 Tumor appears behind left ear. Followed by serial medical incompetence on the parts of PCP, veteran oncologist and pathologist (misdiagnosis via non-diagnosis). Providential guidance to proper care at an NCI designated comprehensive cancer center. 07/08 Age 56 DX 1) Peripheral T-Cell Lymphoma-Not Otherwise Specified. Stage IV-B, >50 ("innumerable") tumors, bone marrow involvement. 08/08-12/08 Four cycles CHOEP14 + four cycles GND (Cyclofosfamide, Doxorubicin, Vincristine, Etoposide, Prednisone & Gemcitabine, Navelbine, Doxil) 02/09 2) Relapse. 03/09-06/13 Clinical trial of Romidepsin > long-term study. NED for 64 twenty-eight day cycles, dose tapered. 07/13 3) Relapse, 4) Suspected Mutation. 08/13-02/14 Romidepsin increased, stopped for lack of response. Watch & Wait. 09/14 Relapse/Progression. Visible cervical nodes appear within 4 days of being checked clear. 10/06/14 One cycle Belinostat. Discontinued to enter second clinical trial. 10/25/14 Clinical trial of Alisertib/Failed - Progression. 01/12/15 Belinostat resumed/Failed - Progression. 02/23/15 02/24/15 Pralatrexate/Failed - Progression. 04/17/15 04/15 Genomic profiling reveals mutation into PTCL-NOS + AngioImmunoblastic T-Cell Lymphoma. Stage IV-B a second time. Two dozen tumors + small intestine (Ileum) involvement. 04/22/15 TEC (Bendamustine, Etoposide, Carboplatin). Full response in two cycles. PET/CT both clear. Third cycle followed. 06/15-07/15 Transplant preparation (X-rays, spinal taps, BMB, blood test, MUGA scan, lung function, CMV screening, C-Diff testing etc. etc. etc.) Intrathecal Methotrexate during spinal tap. BMB reveals 5) 26% blast cells of 20q Deletion Myelodysplastic Syndrome MDS), a bone marrow cancer and precursor to Acute Myeloid Leukemia. 07/11-12/15 Cyclofosfamide + Fludarabine conditioning regimen. 07/16/15 Total Body Irradiation. 07/17/15 Moderate intensity Haploidentical Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplant receiving my son's peripheral blood stem cells. 07/21-22/15 Triple dose Cyclofosfamide + Mesna, followed by immunosuppressants Tacrolimus and Mycophenolate Mofetil. 07/23-08/03/15 Marrow producing zero blood cells. Fever. Hospitalized two weeks. 08/04/15 Engraftment occurs, and blood cells are measurable - released from hospital. 08/13/15 Day 26 - Marrow is 100% donor cells. Platelets climbing steadily, red cells follow. 09/21/15 Acute skin Graft versus Host Disease arrives. DEXA scan reveals Osteoporosis. 09/26/-11/03/15 Prednisone to control skin GvHD. 11/2015 Acute GvHD re-classified to Chronic Graft versus Host Disease. 05/2016 Tacrolimus stopped. Prednisone from 30-90mg daily tried. Sirolimus begun. Narrow-band UV-B therapy started, but discontinued for lack of response. One treatment of P-UVAreceived, but halted due to medication reaction. 09/16/16 Three skin punch biopsies. 11/04/16 GvHD clinical trial of Ofatumumab (Arzerra) + Prednisone + Methylprednisolone begun. 12/16 Type II Diabetes, Hypertension - both treatment-related. 05/17 Extracorporeal Photopheresis (ECP) begun in attempt to control chronic Graft-versus-Host-Disease (cGvHD. 8 year old Power Port removed and replaced with Vortex (Smart) Port for ECP. 05/2017 Chronic anemia (low hematocrit). Chronic kidney disease. Cataracts from radiation and steroids. 06/17 Trying various antibiotics in a search for tolerable prophylaxis. 08/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals the presence of 2% cells with 20q Deletion Myelodysplastic Syndrome, considered to be Minimum Residual Disease. 12/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals no abnormalities in the marrow - MDS eradicated. The steroid taper continues. 01/18 Consented for Kadmon clinical trial. 03/18 Began 400mg daily of KD025, a rho-Associated Coiled-coil Kinase 2 Inhibitor (ROCK2). 09/18 Due to refractory GvHD, Extracorporeal Photopheresis halted after 15 months ue to lack of additional benefit. 10/18 I was withdrawn from the Kadmon KD025 clinical trial due to increasing fatigue/lack of benefit. 11/18 Began therapy with Ruxolitinib (Jakafi), a JAK 1&2 inhibitor class drug. Started at half-dose due to concerns with drug interactions. To date: 1 cancer, relapse, second relapse/mutation into 2 cancers, then 3 cancers simultaneously, 20 chemotherapy/GVHD drugs in 11 regimens (4 of them at least twice), 5 salvage regimens, 4 clinical trials, 5 post-transplant immuno-suppressant/modulatory drugs, the equivalent of 1,000 years of background radiation from 40+ CT series scans and about 24 PET scans. Both lymphoid and myeloid malignancies lend a certain symmetry to the hematological journey. Believing in the redemptive value of suffering makes all the difference.

Posts.Title: Trump's Reported PSA by his Dr.

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Bravehardon From a distance I would suggest you may just have a prostate infection or another type of urinary infection. And I've never heard "Leg Tingling" being a symptom of PC. Allen Right now, I have pain, numbness and tingling in my left arm and jaw. Heart attack? Nope. Enlarged lymph nodes impinging on nerves. Since your infection is in the groin, I think it is very likely that you have some enlarged groin lymph nodes. It is not a stretch to think that one of these is also impinging on a leg nerve that passes through the area. As to elevated PSA levels, here is a link which identifies 7 non-cancerous causes of elevated PSA: http://www.everydayhealth.com/prosta...-are-high.aspx

The steroid taper continues. 01/18 Consented for Kadmon clinical trial. 03/18 Began 400mg daily of KD025, a rho-Associated Coiled-coil Kinase 2 Inhibitor (ROCK2). 09/18 Due to refractory GvHD, Extracorporeal Photopheresis halted after 15 months ue to lack of additional benefit. 10/18 I was withdrawn from the Kadmon KD025 clinical trial due to increasing fatigue/lack of benefit. 11/18 Began therapy with Ruxolitinib (Jakafi), a JAK 1&2 inhibitor class drug. Started at half-dose due to concerns with drug interactions. To date: 1 cancer, relapse, second relapse/mutation into 2 cancers, then 3 cancers simultaneously, 20 chemotherapy/GVHD drugs in 11 regimens (4 of them at least twice), 5 salvage regimens, 4 clinical trials, 5 post-transplant immuno-suppressant/modulatory drugs, the equivalent of 1,000 years of background radiation from 40+ CT series scans and about 24 PET scans. Both lymphoid and myeloid malignancies lend a certain symmetry to the hematological journey. Believing in the redemptive value of suffering makes all the difference.

Posts.Title: Cranberry pills

Posts.Content: From the website, it appears to contain scorpion toxin. That toxin seems primarily to consist of neurotoxins and enzyme inhibitors. Medical uses are as immune suppression, although one variety is being investigated for potential binding to glioma cells. There appears to be no reliable information regarding its medical effectiveness. As such, I am closing this thread to prevent misinformation or confusion.
Posts.Title: About Vidatox Cancer Medication

Posts.Content: As to scar tissue in general, some bodies produce more of it than others. I have had two surgeries on my lumbar spine, for example. After the second surgery, the surgeon told me "You had a lot of scar tissue - about the worst I've seen." And yes, that recovery took longer than the first, and left issues that persist to this day. Having said this, none of this is to be taken as if it will impact your specific case.

Posts.Title: Scar tissue and biopsy

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear of this. First, take one step at a time. Our bodies, over the course of our lives, may have cysts, lumps, nodules and various other abnormalities. If we are not scanned or otherwise checked, we generally never know of them. It is very early in the diagnostic process, but the wait itself can almost be a killer. For now, the best advice is: You do not have cancer until a pathology report says you have cancer.

Fever. Hospitalized two weeks. 08/04/15 Engraftment occurs, and blood cells are measurable - released from hospital. 08/13/15 Day 26 - Marrow is 100% donor cells. Platelets climbing steadily, red cells follow. 09/21/15 Acute skin Graft versus Host Disease arrives. DEXA scan reveals Osteoporosis. 09/26/-11/03/15 Prednisone to control skin GvHD. 11/2015 Acute GvHD re-classified to Chronic Graft versus Host Disease. 05/2016 Tacrolimus stopped. Started at half-dose due to concerns with drug interactions. Posts.Title: Doctor found nodule during DRE, my first ever, no PSA record.. long history of UTI

Posts.Content: I am reminded of Gilbert Gottfried as the voice of the parrot Iago in Aladdin: "Why am I not surprised?" Up here in the gray, cloudy Pacific Northwest, I have been supplementing Vitamin D. After my last blood test, I was told to hold the supplement as my Vitamin D level was too high. Good this week, bad the next.

Posts.Title: Vitamin D supplement not as effective as real sunlight and a normal BMI

Posts.Content: Irritation of any type along the urethra can last for some time. I had a catheter for a PET scan and urination was very painful for several days, and remained painful for two weeks. UTIs produce pain, and it appears that you had one, since it responded to antibiotics. And,as we find out, strenuous exercise, sexual activity or riding a bike can increase PSA. As well, that PSA reading is a snapshot of a level which has changed. Where is it now?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by WifeinWorry what does it mean when you have a yellow ribbon on your titles and you got moved, to where?? What this does is combine all of your threads and keep them under a single roof, so to speak. Otherwise, replies to the various threads are scattered and difficult to monitor, and others' threads may get bumped off the front page, meaning that they will probably not receive additional replies. It is an administrative move that places a particular situation, such as your husband's journey, into a cohesive, chronological order. You may simply post updates or additional question to the "master thread". You can add a title to each post to indicate your question or concern.

Posts.Title: Chinese herbs

Posts.Content: Eternal rest grant him, O Lord, and let perpetual light shine upon him. May his soul, and the souls of all the faithful departed, through the mercy of God, rest in peace. Mercifully grant the consolation of your Spirit to his loved ones in this, their time of sorrow. Amen.
Posts.Title: RIP Charles Krauthammer

Posts.Content: Very sorry to hear this. It does sound like a very difficult situation. If he were to receive any treatment at all, it would probably make dialysis necessary, and that is a stress unto itself. Since none of us knows, or can accurately predict the future, the only thing we are certain of is that each and every moment spent with him is golden.

Posts.Title: Dad is now in assisted living.

Posts.Content: Total up the cost of all of those herbs from the start. Now, consider that they have either: 1) caused a 50% increase in PSA or 2) failed to prevent it. Neither is acceptable. As to his 90 year old father, cancer is far more complicated than that, being based on individual DNA. Your husband's DNA is substantially different from his dad's. His immune system is also substantially different. This PSA spike "may" indicate that the cancer is becoming more aggressive, or at least growing. Cancer is a living part of us and can adapt faster than we can. The fact that he has cancer indicates that it is growing faster than his immune system can kill it. A urologist who specializes in PC is a must. Now you might currently have the nicest, most amiable urologist on earth, but I would rather have a gruff specialist who would save my life than a nice guy who would gladly attend my funeral.

Posts.Title: Fear is a liar

Posts.Content: It is utterly surprising how many cancer patients come to view their cancer as a blessing. That is exactly my view, as I have had experiences, traveled to various places and met innumerable people that I never would have otherwise. I have an acute sense of the fragility of life, as well as the blessing that each day is. I am certainly stronger as to fortitude. I pray only that others who are struggling may come to this same vantage point. May all have an enjoyable day spending time with those who are most difficult to spend time with!

Providential guidance to proper care at an NCI designated comprehensive cancer center. 07/08 Age 56 DX 1) Peripheral T-Cell Lymphoma-Not Otherwise Specified. Stage IV-B, >50 ("innumerable") tumors, bone marrow involvement. 08/08-12/08 Four cycles CHOEP14 + four cycles GND (Cyclofosfamide, Doxorubicin, Vincristine, Etoposide, Prednisone & Gemcitabine, Navelbine, Doxil) 02/09 2) Relapse. 03/09-06/13 Clinical trial of Romidepsin > long-term study. NED for 64 twenty-eight day cycles, dose tapered. 07/13 3) Relapse, 4) Suspected Mutation. 08/13-02/14 Romidepsin increased, stopped for lack of response. Watch & Wait. 09/14 Relapse/Progression. Visible cervical nodes appear within 4 days of being checked clear. 10/06/14 One cycle Belinostat. Discontinued to enter second clinical trial. 10/25/14 Clinical trial of Alisertib/Failed - Progression. 01/12/15 Belinostat resumed/Failed - Progression. 02/23/15 02/24/15 Pralatrexate/Failed - Progression. 04/17/15 04/15 Genomic profiling reveals mutation into PTCL-NOS + AngioImmunoblastic T-Cell Lymphoma. Stage IV-B a second time. Two dozen tumors + small intestine (Ileum) involvement. 04/22/15 TEC (Bendamustine, Etoposide, Carboplatin). Full response in two cycles. PET/CT both clear. Third cycle followed. 06/15-07/15 Transplant preparation (X-rays, spinal taps, BMB, blood test, MUGA scan, lung function, CMV screening, C-Diff testing etc. etc. etc.) Intrathecal Methotrexate during spinal tap. BMB reveals 5) 26% blast cells of 20q Deletion Myelodysplastic Syndrome MDS), a bone marrow cancer and precursor to Acute Myeloid Leukemia. 07/11-12/15 Cyclofosfamide + Fludarabine conditioning regimen. 07/16/15 Total Body Irradiation. 07/17/15 Moderate intensity Haploidentical Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplant receiving my son's peripheral blood stem cells. 07/21-22/15 Triple dose Cyclofosfamide + Mesna, followed by immunosuppressants Tacrolimus and Mycophenolate Mofetil. 07/23-08/03/15 Marrow producing zero blood cells. Fever. Hospitalized two weeks. 08/04/15 Engraftment occurs, and blood cells are measurable - released from hospital. 08/13/15 Day 26 - Marrow is 100% donor cells. Platelets climbing steadily, red cells follow. 09/21/15 Acute skin Graft versus Host Disease arrives. DEXA scan reveals Osteoporosis. 09/26/-11/03/15 Prednisone to control skin GvHD. 11/2015 Acute GvHD re-classified to Chronic Graft versus Host Disease. 05/2016 Tacrolimus stopped. Prednisone from 30-90mg daily tried. Sirolimus begun. Narrow-band UV-B therapy started, but discontinued for lack of response. One treatment of P-UVAreceived, but halted due to medication reaction. 09/16/16 Three skin punch biopsies. 11/04/16 GvHD clinical trial of Ofatumumab (Arzerra) + Prednisone + Methylprednisolone begun. 12/16 Type II Diabetes, Hypertension - both treatment-related. 05/17 Extracorporeal Photopheresis (ECP) begun in attempt to control chronic Graft-versus-Host-Disease (cGvHD. 8 year old Power Port removed and replaced with Vortex (Smart) Port for ECP. 05/2017 Chronic anemia (low hematocrit). Chronic kidney disease. Cataracts from radiation and steroids. 06/17 Trying various antibiotics in a search for tolerable prophylaxis. 08/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals the presence of 2% cells with 20q Deletion Myelodysplastic Syndrome, considered to be Minimum Residual Disease. 12/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals no abnormalities in the marrow - MDS eradicated. The steroid taper continues. 01/18 Consented for Kadmon clinical trial. 03/18 Began 400mg daily of KD025, a rho-Associated Coiled-coil Kinase 2 Inhibitor (ROCK2). 09/18 Due to refractory GvHD, Extracorporeal Photopheresis halted after 15 months ue to lack of additional benefit. 10/18 I was withdrawn from the Kadmon KD025 clinical trial due to increasing fatigue/lack of benefit. 11/18 Began therapy with Ruxolitinib (Jakafi), a JAK 1&2 inhibitor class drug. Started at half-dose due to concerns with drug interactions. To date: 1 cancer, relapse, second relapse/mutation into 2 cancers, then 3 cancers simultaneously, 20 chemotherapy/GVHD drugs in 11 regimens (4 of them at least twice), 5 salvage regimens, 4 clinical trials, 5 post-transplant immuno-suppressant/modulatory drugs, the equivalent of 1,000 years of background radiation from 40+ CT series scans and about 24 PET scans. Both lymphoid and myeloid malignancies lend a certain symmetry to the hematological journey. Believing in the redemptive value of suffering makes all the difference.
Posts.Title: Being thankful in times of challenge!

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear of this. I take note of the username you have chosen. Is there a certain pessimism there? I can relate only my personal anecdote, but my prognosis began as poor. It dropped within six months to extremely poor. Since that point it has dropped at least twice again, and I have picked up several potentially fatal conditions, mostly due to treatment. There is not a word in the English language to describe how abysmal my prognosis is. But, this all began over nine years ago. What I have learned is to enjoy each day, as tomorrow is guaranteed to absolutely no one. Fears about the future steal our todays from us - and today is all we possess.

Posts.Title: Am I getting the truth

Posts.Content: Total up the cost of all of those herbs from the start. Now, consider that they have either: 1) caused a 50% increase in PSA or 2) failed to prevent it. Neither is acceptable. As to his 90 year old father, cancer is far more complicated than that, being based on individual DNA. Your husband's DNA is substantially different from his dad's. His immune system is also substantially different. This PSA spike "may" indicate that the cancer is becoming more aggressive, or at least growing. Cancer is a living part of us and can adapt faster than we can. The fact that he has cancer indicates that it is growing faster than his immune system can kill it. A urologist who specializes in PC is a must. Now you might currently have the nicest, most amiable urologist on earth, but I would rather have a gruff specialist who would save my life than a nice guy who would gladly attend my funeral.

Posts.Title: Chinese herbs

Posts.Content: A non-prostate specific drug that might be considered is Trazodone. It is primarily and antidepressant with some anti-anxiety qualities, but it also can help with BPH and in some men, has a Cialis-like effect. I was prescribed it as it is a great sleep aid. It is a "clean" drug in that its side effects are usually mild and one can start or stop it without worry in most cases. It is cheap and well proven. For those who are anxious or somewhat depressed over the whole situation, it might cover several concerns. It may not be for you, but is worth asking about.

Fever. Hospitalized two weeks. 08/04/15 Engraftment occurs, and blood cells are measurable - released from hospital. 08/13/15 Day 26 - Marrow is 100% donor cells. Platelets climbing steadily, red cells follow. 09/21/15 Acute skin Graft versus Host Disease arrives. DEXA scan reveals Osteoporosis. 09/26/-11/03/15 Prednisone to control skin GvHD. 11/2015 Acute GvHD re-classified to Chronic Graft versus Host Disease. 05/2016 Tacrolimus stopped. Prednisone from 30-90mg daily tried. Sirolimus begun. Narrow-band UV-B therapy started, but discontinued for lack of response. One treatment of P-UVAreceived, but halted due to medication reaction. 09/16/16 Three skin punch biopsies. 11/04/16 GvHD clinical trial of Ofatumumab (Arzerra) + Prednisone + Methylprednisolone begun. 12/16 Type II Diabetes, Hypertension - both treatment-related. 05/17 Extracorporeal Photopheresis (ECP) begun in attempt to control chronic Graft-versus-Host-Disease (cGvHD. 8 year old Power Port removed and replaced with Vortex (Smart) Port for ECP. 05/2017 Chronic anemia (low hematocrit). Chronic kidney disease. Cataracts from radiation and steroids. 06/17 Trying various antibiotics in a search for tolerable prophylaxis. 08/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals the presence of 2% cells with 20q Deletion Myelodysplastic Syndrome, considered to be Minimum Residual Disease. 12/17 Bone marrow biopsy reveals no abnormalities in the marrow - MDS eradicated. The steroid taper continues. 01/18 Consented for Kadmon clinical trial. 03/18 Began 400mg daily of KD025, a rho-Associated Coiled-coil Kinase 2 Inhibitor (ROCK2). 09/18 Due to refractory GvHD, Extracorporeal Photopheresis halted after 15 months ue to lack of additional benefit. 10/18 I was withdrawn from the Kadmon KD025 clinical trial due to increasing fatigue/lack of benefit. 11/18 Began therapy with Ruxolitinib (Jakafi), a JAK 1&2 inhibitor class drug. Started at half-dose due to concerns with drug interactions. To date: 1 cancer, relapse, second relapse/mutation into 2 cancers, then 3 cancers simultaneously, 20 chemotherapy/GVHD drugs in 11 regimens (4 of them at least twice), 5 salvage regimens, 4 clinical trials, 5 post-transplant immuno-suppressant/modulatory drugs, the equivalent of 1,000 years of background radiation from 40+ CT series scans and about 24 PET scans. Both lymphoid and myeloid malignancies lend a certain symmetry to the hematological journey. Believing in the redemptive value of suffering makes all the difference.

Posts.Title: Chinese herbs

Posts.Content: A non-prostate specific drug that might be considered is Trazodone. It is primarily and antidepressant with some anti-anxiety qualities, but it also can help with BPH and in some men, has a Cialis-like effect. I was prescribed it as it is a great sleep aid. It is a "clean" drug in that its side effects are usually mild and one can start or stop it without worry in most cases. It is cheap and well proven. For those who are anxious or somewhat depressed over the whole situation, it might cover several concerns. It may not be for you, but is worth asking about.

Posts.Title: Fear is a liar

Posts.Content: Eternal rest grant him, O Lord, and let perpetual light shine upon him. May his soul, and the souls of all the faithful departed, through the mercy of God, rest in peace. Mercifully grant the consolation of your Spirit to his loved ones in this, their time of sorrow. Amen.
Posts.Title: RIP Charles Krauthammer
